Categorize cases based on external data and classification scheme

Source: R/categorize.R
categorize.Rd

Categorize cases based on external data and classification scheme

categorize(
  data,
  codedata,
  cc,
  id,
  index = NULL,
  sort = TRUE,
  codify_args = list(),
  cc_args = list()
)

Arguments

data

data frame with mandatory id column (identified by argument id), and semi-optional column with date of interest (identified by argument date if days != NULL).
codedata

external code data (see as.codedata)
cc

classcodes object (or name of such object).
id

name of code/id columns (in codified).
index

control possible inclusion of index vector. Set to FALSE if no index should be calculated, otherwise a value passed to argument by in function index. It is possible to include several indices as a character vector. NULL will include all available indices as specified by the "indices" attribute of the cc object (attr(cc, "indices"))
sort

logical. Should output be sorted by the 'id' column? (This could effect computational speed for large data sets.) Data is sorted by 'id' internally. It is therefore faster to keep the output sorted this way, but this might be inconvenient if the original order was intended. Set to FALSE in order to not shuffle the input data.
codify_args

List of named arguments passed to codify
cc_args

List with named arguments passed to set_classcodes

Value

Object of class data.table made from data combined with logical columns indicating membership of categories identified by the classcodes object (the cc argument). Indices are also included if specified by the 'index' argument.

See also

Other verbs: classify(), codify(), index_fun

Examples

# Add Elixhauser based on all registered ICD10-codes
categorize(ex_people, ex_icd10, "elixhauser", id = "name")
#> Classification based on: regex_icd10

# Add Charlson categories and two versions of a calculated index.
# Only include recent hospital visits within 30 days before surgery,
# and use technical variable names to clearly identify the new columns.
categorize(ex_people, ex_icd10, "charlson",
  id = "name",
  index = c("quan_original", "quan_updated"),
  codify_args = list(date = "event", days = c(-30, -1)),
  cc_args = list(tech_names = TRUE)
)
